result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. Flynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Flynn

defendant.name: Flynn, Christopher J.
defendant.address: 3140 W Folsom St, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 9:32 AM)
Defendant Christopher Flynn appears without counsel via Zoom videoconference.  Attorney Tiffany Winter appears for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom videoconference. 
Defendant wishes to take the offer from the State.  Defendant advised of his Constitutional rights, as well as the elements and maximum possible penalties of the offense to which he will plead. Court finds Defendant guilty based on plea of No Contest to Count 1: Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse).  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.   Court costs, with domestic abuse surcharge, are ordered.  Defendant's address on Folsom Street is confirmed to be updated and accurate.
CK 44082 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail posted refunded.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

11:25 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher J. Flynn in court without counsel. 
Waives reading of the complaint. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7-25-22 at 2:00 PM. 
Return to court: 8-15-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
